channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Boeing issues layoff notices to more than 400 workers as it begins drastic cuts
item.description: Boeing announced in October that it planned to cut 10% of its workforce, about 17,000 jobs, in the coming months.

item.title: Trump nominates fracking magnate and climate change skeptic as energy secretary
item.description: Trump called Liberty Energy's Chris Wright "one of the pioneers who helped launch the American Shale Revolution."

item.title: Dow ends 300 points lower as rate-cut doubts stall postelection rally
Weekend Reads: Will Nvidia’s earnings report signal a stock-market pullback?
Musk backs Howard Lutnick as Treasury secretary and calls Scott Bessent ‘business-as-usual choice’
item.description: “Business-as-usual is driving America bankrupt, so we need change," Musk said.

item.title: TikTok parent ByteDance valued at about $300 billion, WSJ says
item.description: A tender offer to employees in October 2023 valued ByteDance at $225 billion, and a December 2023 buyback boosted the valuation to $268 billion.

item.title: Investors are bracing for higher-for-even-longer interest rates
Super Micro’s looming deadline fuels fear of delisting. Here’s what that means.
Trump may again seek cuts to Medicaid. Here’s who would be affected.
Netflix’s Tyson-Paul boxing bout gets 65 million viewers at peak
item.description: More than 100,000 users reported network issues on the Downdetector website throughout the livestreaming of the Paul vs. Tyson fight.
